solution.text:
Total cost price = number of soaps x cost per soap
Total CP = _{{10*j}}_ x _{{20*k}}_ = Rs. _{{200*j*k}}_
Number of soaps available = total number - number of spoiled soaps = _{{10*j}}_-_{{2*j}}_=_{{8*j}}_
Total selling price = number of soaps available x selling price of soap
Total SP= _{{8*j}}_ x _{{30*k}}_= Rs. _{{240*j*k}}_
\( \Rightarrow \) Since SP>CP. Profit = SP-CP = _{{240*j*k}}_-_{{200*j*k}}_= Rs. _{{40*j*k}}_

content.text: A shopkeeper buys _{{10*j}}_ soap bars for Rs. _{{20*k}}_ each. Out of this _{{2*j}}_ soap bars get spoiled and cannot be sold. He sells the remaining soap bars for Rs. _{{30*k}}_. What profit or loss did he make?
